name: jimenez-http-communication
description: helper classes to make http requests
readme: [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/rogithub/jimenez-http-communication.svg?branch=importclasses)](https://travis-ci.org/rogithub/jimenez-http-communication) # jimenez-http-communication It provides js classes to make http calls ## Install $ npm install jimenez-http-communication ##Content - [Install](#install) - [Content](#content) - [Usage](#usage) - [serverInfo](#header1) - [endPoint](#header2) - [request](#header3) ##Usage ###serverInfo Creates a url to a server using protocol, domain name and optionally port. ####Example ```javascript var jhc = require('jimenez-http-communication'); var serverInfo = jhc.serverInfo("https", "localhost", 5984); console.log(serverInfo.getUrl()); ``` output: "https://localhost:5984" ###endPoint Creates the uri part for an endpoint. Its constructor receives a configuration object with the following properties: ####Example ```javascript var jhc = require('jimenez-http-communication'); var config = { uri: "contribuyentes/:id/:name", urlParams: { rev: 12345, tax: 18.3 }, routeParams: { id: "abcd", name: "test" } }; var ep = jhc.endPoint(config); console.log(ep.getUrl()); ``` output: "contribuyentes/abcd/test?rev=12345&tax=18.3" ###request Returns a [Q](https://github.com/kriskowal/q) promise based on endPoint and serverInfo objects. ####Example ```javascript var jhc = require('jimenez-http-communication'); var request = jhc.request(); var promise = request.getPromise(serverInfo, endPoint); ```
